content.title: Scheme for Conservation and Development of Indigenous Cattle and Murrah Development
content.department: Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana
content.details: The scheme aims to encourage farmers for conservation and development of Indigenous breeds of cows and buffaloes. It includes cash incentives for owners of identified Murrah buffaloes and indigenous cows based on their peak milk yield.
benefits: Cash incentives for Murrah buffaloes ranging from ₹15,000 to ₹30,000 based on peak yield.
Cash incentives for indigenous cows (Hariana, Sahiwal, Belahi) ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹20,000 based on peak yield.
Insurance for identified animals with part of the premium covered by the scheme.
eligibility: Applicant must be a resident of Haryana.
Applicant must be aged between 18 and 55 years.
Eligible animals must be between 5 to 75 days of calving at the time of application.
A maximum of two milch animals per applicant are eligible for incentives.
Cows must be true to Hariana, Sahiwal, or Belahi breed; buffalo must be of Murrah breed.
Incentives can be provided only twice in an animal's lifespan.
exclusions: Groups, firms, or organizations are not permitted to apply.
content.application_process: Online application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to encourage farmers in Haryana to conserve and develop indigenous breeds of cows and buffaloes.

faqs.question: Who implements the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What are the long-term goals of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The long-term goals include the conservation and upgrading of valuable indigenous germplasm and increasing milk production and overall productivity.

faqs.question: What are the medium-term goals of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The medium-term goals include identifying top-quality germplasm of indigenous breeds and encouraging farmers to rear high-yielding animals of genetic merit.

faqs.question: How are the Murrah buffaloes identified under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Murrah buffaloes meeting a daily peak yield benchmark of 18 kg are identified with ear tags, along with their progeny.

faqs.question: What incentives are provided for Murrah buffalo owners?
faqs.answer: Cash incentives ranging from ₹15,000 to ₹30,000 are provided to owners of identified Murrah buffaloes.

faqs.question: What breeds of cows are eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Hariana, Sahiwal, and Belahi breeds are eligible.

faqs.question: What breed of buffalo is eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only the Murrah breed is eligible.

faqs.question: How can one apply online for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted online via the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
